title: U.S. EPA Recognizes Citi for Leading Green Power Purchase
summary: New York - The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Green Power Partnership named financial services leader Citi to its National Top 50 list of the largest green power purchasers. The Green Power Partnership's Top Partner Rankings highlight the annual green power purchases of leading organizations in the United States. These green power purchases help reduce the environmental impacts of electricity use and support the development of new renewable generation capacity nationwide, according to the Partnership.
tag-1: U.S. EPA Recognizes Citi for Leading Green Power Purchase
tag-2: New York – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's Green Power Partnership named financial services leader Citi to its National Top 50 list of the largest green power purchasers. The Green Power Partnership's Top Partner Rankings highlight the annual green power purchases of leading organizations in the United States. These green power purchases help reduce the environmental impacts of electricity use and support the development of new renewable generation capacity nationwide, according to the Partnership.
tag-3: "Citi was one of the first global financial services companies to publicly join the fight to slow climate change," said John Killey, Citi Realty Services' Global Head of Building Operations. "We're proud of that and gratified that our efforts are being recognized by the EPA. We've been exploring innovative ways to increase our operating efficiency through a reduction in our environmental footprint, sustainable IT and design, and many other ways, and our efforts are paying off. We've demonstrated that working toward environmental sustainability makes fundamental business sense."
tag-4: Citi began measuring the environmental impact of its buildings and released its first environmental footprint reduction goal in 2006 (a 10 percent reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by year-end 2011). In 2010, Citi Realty Services expanded on the company's existing goal by creating additional targets for 2015, which include: reducing GHG emissions from buildings 25 percent, reducing waste to landfill by 40 percent, reducing water usage by 20 percent and having 15 percent of its real estate portfolio LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certified by the US Green Building Council.
tag-5: Citi, which celebrates its 200th anniversary in June, has been recognized for its green efforts by Newsweek magazine, the Dow Jones Sustainability Index, IDG's Computerworld, The Banker magazine and others.
tag-6: Read more about Citi's sustainability efforts at http://www.citigroup.com/citi/environment/.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-9: EPA's Green Power Partnership The Green Power Partnership is a voluntary program that encourages organizations to buy green power as a way to reduce the environmental impacts associated with electricity use. The Partnership currently has more than 1,300 Partner organizations voluntarily purchasing billions of kilowatt-hours of green power annually.
